DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim of this study is to determine menthol smokers' perception, product preference, and pattern of use across six products including, mint-flavored nicotine gum; non-flavored nicotine gum; mentholated nicotine inhaler; and non-menthol nicotine inhaler. Participants will undergo an orientation and baseline assessment followed by a 2-week product sampling phase. At the end of the 2 weeks of sampling, subjects will select a product to use during the following 2-week smoking cessation phase. This 2-week abstinence phase is followed by one week of abrupt withdrawal of the product. This study design was successfully used in a study we conducted that examined the smokers' preference for a variety or oral tobacco products.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of Cessation Preferences of Menthol Smokers
DOC.criteria: Selfidentified as African American or Black; Aged 18 years or older; High school graduate or GED; Smoking at least 10 cigarettes daily for the past year; Usually smoked mentholated cigarette brand (greater than 80% of the time) in the past two years; Good physical health (no unstable medical condition); No contraindications for nicotine inhaler or gum use, such as mouth sores or significant dental or jaw problems; Stable, good health. Recent unstable or untreated psychiatric diagnosis including substance abuse, as determined by the DSMIV criteria; Currently using other tobacco or nicotine products other than cigarettes; Pregnant or nursing.
